transportAdvice: Siem Reap has no formal public transit system, so travelers rely on tuk-tuks, motorcycle taxis, and hired cars to get around; the central tourist areas and Old Market district are walkable, but the temple complexes at Angkor require a vehicle. Tuk-tuks are widely available, affordable, and the most popular way for visitors to reach Angkor Wat and surrounding sites.

weather.description: Cool, dry, and sunny — the most comfortable month to visit, with pleasant evenings and ideal temple-exploring conditions.
Warm and dry with clear skies, making it excellent for sightseeing though midday heat begins to build.
Hot and mostly dry with intense midday sun; early morning visits to temples are strongly recommended.
Very hot with occasional afternoon thunderstorms beginning to appear as the wet season approaches.
The wet season begins with increasing rain and humidity, though mornings are often still clear and crowds thin out.
Regular afternoon and evening downpours with lush green landscapes; temples are quieter and prices are lower.
Heavy monsoon rains are common, often in intense bursts; the surrounding countryside floods and turns vivid green.
One of the wettest months with persistent rain and high humidity, but temples remain accessible and visitor numbers are low.
Peak of the wet season with frequent heavy rain and potential flooding around Tonle Sap Lake; a quieter time to visit.
Rain begins to ease toward month's end but remains frequent; the lake reaches its maximum size and boat trips are popular.
The dry season returns with decreasing rain, cooler evenings, and rising tourist numbers as conditions improve.
Cool, dry, and busy — peak tourist season with comfortable temperatures and clear skies perfect for visiting Angkor.
